_header: Jesu Lord welcome Thou be / In form of bread as I Thee see
Note: For very similar lines see Mirk’s Instructions for Parish Priests (1581), lines 290-301; and the ‘Freemasonry’ poem, 6641, lines 643-54. A longer version in 38 lines is 2878.
_description: A prayer at the ‘Leuacion’ — in couplets

BodLye30.First Lines:
Ihesu lord wel come ye be In forme of bred as i you
                    see…
BodLye30.Last Lines:
…My rught beleve er i be dedHovfull be my last
                    bred
BodLye30.Note: 10 lines; scribe writes, ffiat amen at end.
BodLye30.Attributed Title:
Oracio devota in anglicis verbis ad eleuationem corpori cristi (f.
                        300v)

CULIi62.First Lines:
O Jhesu lorde wellcum thu bein fforme of bred as y the
                    se…
CULIi62.Last Lines:
…and let me neuer for no syneLese the blysse that thu art
                    In
CULIi62.Note: Added to original blank leaf at end of volume.

BLAdd27924.First Lines:
Ihesu my lord Welcome thou beIn forme of brede as I the
                    se…
BLAdd27924.Last Lines:
…Ne lete me neuer so forto synneThat I forbere the ioye that
                    thou art inne
BLAdd27924.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Authors of the Middle English Religious Lyric.” 
             Journal of English and Germanic Philology
         39 (1940): 230-8: 137-8.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 115.

BLEge3245.First Lines: Ihesu lord welcom þow beIn forme of bred as I þe see…
BLEge3245.Last Lines: …Ryht be leue be forn my ded dayAnd blisse wiþ the þat leste schal ay
BLEge3245.Note: Includes six lines of 1604; here 12 lines in couplets followed by a prayer beginning with a couplet but turning to prose: “Almyhty god mercyful haue mercy on me sinful And on alle cristene to þe lord ihesu I me be take & to þy modir blisful In nomine patris & filii & spiritus sancti.”
BLEge3245.Attributed Title: Here beginniþ a deuout preyer vn to þe holy sacrament of þe auteer
BLEge3245.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Gurney Series of Religious Lyrics.” 
             PMLA
         54 (1939): 369-90: 378.

BNfr1830.Transcription:
Jesu welcome mote þow beIn forme of bred os I þe
                    seJesu for þin holy nameKepe me fro synne & schameAs
                    þou art of a maydyn bornLate me neuere be for lornN[e] late me
                    neuere for myn synneLese þe ioyȝe þat þou art
                    inne
BNfr1830.Note: Last two lines written down side of page; 8 lines.
BNfr1830.Editions:
Barratt,  Alexandra. 
             “A Middle English Lyric in an Old French Manuscript.” 
             Medium Ævum
         5 (1983): 226-9: 229.
